id: 'Game of Thrones' prequel casts Naomi Watts
paragraph: SettingsCancelSetHave an existing account?Already have a subscription?Don't have an account?Get the newsLet friends in your social network know what you are reading about"King Kong" and "Mulholland Drive" actress Naomi Watts is the first casting announcement for the show set thousands of years before "Game of Thrones."A link has been sent to your friend's email address.A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQsNaomi Watts is the first cast member announced for HBO's planned "Game of Thrones" prequel.(Photo: Dimitrios Kambouris, Getty Images for Michael Kors)Welcome to Westeros, Naomi Watts.The Oscar-nominated "King Kong" and "Mulholland Drive" star is the first actor to be attached to a prequel set thousands of years before "Game of Thrones," HBO has confirmed.Watts will play a character that is described in a release as "a charismatic socialite hiding a dark secret."The as-yet-untitled series, as HBO has previously announced, "chronicles the world’s descent from the Golden Age of Heroes into its darkest hour" and will tell plenty of origin stories, including that of the White Walkers.HBO has moved forward with a pilot episode of the show, which is the first four "Game of Thrones" follow-up options the pay-cable network has considered.British screenwriter and producer Jane Goldman ("Kingsman" franchise, "X-Men: First Class," "Kick Ass") is set to write the prequel with George R.R. Martin, the author of the books on which "Thrones" is based. "Game of Thrones" creators David Benioff and D.B. Weiss, meanwhile, will be working on a series of "Star Wars" films. Contributing: Bill KeveneyA link has been posted to your Facebook feed.
